title: Delhi Wakes Up To 'Severe' Air Quality, EU Delegation To Visit Kashmir + Other Stories
text:
It’s the day after Diwali and air pollution has touched severe mark in many locations in North India, particularly around the National Capital Territory of New Delhi while most other parts of the country did not signs of being affected.

On late Sunday evening, a layer of haze had blanketed the national capital and its air quality dipped to "very poor" category with revellers continuing to defy with impunity the Supreme Court-enforced two-hour limit for bursting crackers on Diwali. Read more.

2. Air India Will Mark 550th Gurpurab Celebrations With 'Ek Onkar' Symbol On Its Aircraft

India’s national carrier Air India has decided to install a special symbol on its aircraft that will fly between Amritsar and London to mark the 550th birth anniversary of the first guru and the founder of the Sikh faith Guru Nanak Dev.

In a first gesture of its kind by an Indian airline, the symbol of “Ek Onkar” will be painted on the plane’s tail while the fuselage will be marked with the words ‘Shri Guru Nanak Dev ji 550 Years Celebrations’.

Don't Miss 1.2 K SHARES 1.5 K SHARES

As part of 550th Parkash Utsav celebrations of Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji, the fundamental teaching of Sikhism ੴ 'Ek Onkar' will be painted on aircraft that will operate on the thrice weekly @airindiain flights between Sri Amritsar Sahib & London (Stansted) from 31st Oct 2019. pic.twitter.com/r69nU1IkwG — Hardeep Singh Puri (@HardeepSPuri) October 27, 2019

A central tenet of Sikh religious philosophy, “Ek Onkar” means God is one. Read more.

3. Didn't Renew Driving Licence For A Year? Now You'll Have To Take Learner's Test Again

If you fail to renew your driving licence within a year of its expiry, you will now have to start again from scratch. You will be treated as a new learner and have to apply for a computerised 20-mark test for a learner’s licence and wait for 30 days for the permanent licence driving test.

According to a report in The Times Of India, regional transport officer Abhay Deshpande said, “We have to abide by the Motor Vehicles (amendment) Act. Maharashtra has started implementing it at all 50 RTOs.” Read more

4. MCD Sprinkles Water On Roads As #DelhiChokes & People Complain Of Breathing Issues After Diwali

The Internet is filled with the news of the aftermath of the Diwali celebrations - Delhi NCR is choking. Air is not fit to breathe. Pollution levels are off the charts; at some places the safe limit of AQI has been crossed by 16-20 times. However, there are some people who still seem to be justifying the bursting of crackers, and the pollution and littering that followed.

These people do not seem to care for those suffering from respiratory issues like asthma or even their own health, in general. The excess pollution during Diwali makes life difficult for everyone; we all end up inhaling smoke and toxins we really should not be. Strays and pets are massively frightened and scared of the noise that is produced. Read more

5. EU Delegation Of 27 Lawmakers From 11 Countries Will Visit Kashmir To Assess The Situation

A group of European Union lawmakers will visit Kashmir on Tuesday, the first foreign delegation since the special status of Jammu and Kashmir was revoked in August.

News Agency Reuters quoted Indian officials confirming the upcoming visit by EU lawmakers. Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led NDA government withdrew Jammu and Kashmir’s autonomy in August. The move was accompanied by a crackdown on dissent by security forces there, to head off protests. Read more.
